byline.contributor: Edward Wong reported from Jianli, and Michael Forsythe from Hong Kong. David Barboza contributed reporting from Shanghai, and Keith Bradsher from Hong Kong. Mia Li, Kiki Zhao, Adam Wu and Vanessa Piao contributed research.
byline.original: By EDWARD WONG and MICHAEL FORSYTHE

abstract: Only 14 people have been rescued from Chinese passenger ship Oriental Star, which capsized in Yangtze River, and 430 others remain missing; twelve passengers are confirmed dead, but officials say more people might be alive in cruise ship.
lead_paragraph: More than a day after the Oriental Star capsized in Hubei Province, China, most of the people on board were still missing.

headline.main: Few Triumphs in Frantic Hunt for 430 in Yangtze River
headline.print_headline: Few Triumphs in Frantic Hunt for 430 in Yangtze

snippet: More than a day after the Oriental Star capsized in Hubei Province, China, most of the people on board were still missing.
